com.mediaworx.opencms.moduleutils.manifestgenerator

Class OpenCmsModuleManifestGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mediaworx.opencms.moduleutils.manifestgenerator.OpenCmsModuleManifestGenerator

  • public class OpenCmsModuleManifestGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates the manifest.xml for OpenCms modules from meta files (manifest_stub.xml and separate meta files for all files and folders in the VFS). The manifest_stub.xml must contain all module specific data, structured exactly like in a standard OpenCms module manifest, but the files node must be empty.

    Sample manifest_stub.xml: 
     <export>
     <info>
         <creator>Admin</creator>
         <opencms_version>8.5.1</opencms_version>
         <createdate>Tue, 17 Dec 2013 14:04:17 GMT</createdate>
         <infoproject>Offline</infoproject>
         <export_version>7</export_version>
     </info>
     <module>
         <name>com.mediaworx.opencms.intellijconnector</name>
         <nicename><![CDATA[IntelliJ Plugin Connector]]></nicename>
         <class/>
         <description><![CDATA[Connects the IntelliJ Plugin to OpenCms]]></description>
         <version>0.2</version>
         <authorname><![CDATA[Kai Widmann]]></authorname>
         <authoremail><![CDATA[widmann@mediaworx.com]]></authoremail>
         <datecreated/>
         <userinstalled/>
         <dateinstalled/>
         <dependencies/>
         <exportpoints>
             <exportpoint uri="/system/modules/com.mediaworx.opencms.intellijconnector/classes/" destination="WEB-INF/classes/"/>
         </exportpoints>
         <resources>
             <resource uri="/system/modules/com.mediaworx.opencms.intellijconnector/"/>
         </resources>
         <parameters/>
     </module>
     <files/>
 </export>

    Meta-Files for VFS files must contain all the meta data for the file that is to be included in the manifest, structured like a file node (type != folder) in a standard OpenCms manifest file, plus additional information about the sibling count of the file, all wrapped in a fileinfo node. The file name for the meta file is equal to the VFS file name with ".ocmsfile.xml" added as suffix.

    Sample meta file for VFS files (test.jsp.ocmsfile.xml): 
     <fileinfo>
     <file>
         <source>${source}</source>
         <destination>${destination}</destination>
         <type>jsp</type>
         <uuidstructure>c76b8773-7c44-11e3-92bb-210cc9a3bba6</uuidstructure>
         <uuidresource>c76b8774-7c44-11e3-92bb-210cc9a3bba6</uuidresource>
         <datelastmodified>Mon, 13 Jan 2014 12:13:24 GMT</datelastmodified>
         <userlastmodified>Admin</userlastmodified>
         <datecreated>Mon, 13 Jan 2014 11:20:59 GMT</datecreated>
         <usercreated>Admin</usercreated>
         <flags>0</flags>
         <properties>
             <property>
                 <name>Title</name>
                 <value><![CDATA[Test Formatter]]></value>
             </property>
             <property type="shared">
                 <name>export</name>
                 <value><![CDATA[false]]></value>
             </property>
         </properties>
         <relations/>
         <accesscontrol>
             <accessentry>
                 <uuidprincipal>GROUP.Guests</uuidprincipal>
                 <flags>32</flags>
                 <permissionset>
                     <allowed>0</allowed>
                     <denied>0</denied>
                 </permissionset>
             </accessentry>
             <accessentry>
                 <uuidprincipal>GROUP.Users</uuidprincipal>
                 <flags>36</flags>
                 <permissionset>
                     <allowed>23</allowed>
                     <denied>0</denied>
                 </permissionset>
             </accessentry>
             <accessentry>
                 <uuidprincipal>USER.Admin</uuidprincipal>
                 <flags>16</flags>
                 <permissionset>
                     <allowed>5</allowed>
                     <denied>26</denied>
                 </permissionset>
             </accessentry>
         </accesscontrol>
     </file>
     <siblingcount>1</siblingcount>
 </fileinfo>

    Meta-Files for VFS folders must contain all the meta data for the folder that is to be included in the manifest, structured like a file node (type == folder) in a standard OpenCms manifest file. The file name for the meta file is equal to the VFS folder name with ".ocmsfolder.xml" added as suffix.

    Sample meta file for VFS files (formatter.ocmsfolder.xml): 
     <file>
     <destination>${destination}</destination>
     <type>folder</type>
     <uuidstructure>b9fb9670-7c44-11e3-92bb-210cc9a3bba6</uuidstructure>
     <datelastmodified>Mon, 13 Jan 2014 11:20:43 GMT</datelastmodified>
     <userlastmodified>Admin</userlastmodified>
     <datecreated>Mon, 13 Jan 2014 11:20:37 GMT</datecreated>
     <usercreated>Admin</usercreated>
     <flags>0</flags>
     <properties>
         <property>
             <name>Title</name>
             <value><![CDATA[Test Formatters]]></value>
         </property>
     </properties>
     <relations/>
     <accesscontrol/>
 </file>

    When putting meta files into version control, there may occur a lot of conflicts because of differing dates (and UUIDs) on local development machines. To avoid conflicts manifest data can be stored with variables instead of dates (and UUIDs). The manifest generator replaces these variables with generated values when a manifest is created. The replacement of meta variables can be triggered separately for dates and UUIDs. We don't recommend storing UUIDs as meta variables

    Sample meta file for VFS files with variables instead of dates and UUIDs (formatter.ocmsfolder.xml): 
     <file>
     <destination>${destination}</destination>
     <type>folder</type>
     <uuidstructure>${uuidstructure}</uuidstructure>
     <datelastmodified>${datelastmodified}</datelastmodified>
     <userlastmodified>Admin</userlastmodified>
     <datecreated>${datecreated}</datecreated>
     <usercreated>Admin</usercreated>
     <flags>0</flags>
     <properties>
         <property>
             <name>Title</name>
             <value><![CDATA[Test Formatters]]></value>
         </property>
     </properties>
     <relations/>
     <accesscontrol/>
 </file>

    mediaworx provides an OpenCms module for pulling the meta files from OpenCms (com.mediaworx.opencms.intellijconnector).

    Revision 1.7

    • Method Detail

      • generateManifest

        public void generateManifest(java.io.File manifestRoot)
                      throws OpenCmsMetaXmlParseException,
                             OpenCmsMetaXmlFileWriteException
        Deprecated. This method is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Please use generateManifest(File, String) instead.
        Generates the manifest.xml for OpenCms modules from meta files (manifest_stub.xml and separate meta files for all files and folders in the VFS).
        Parameters:
        manifestRoot - file representing the root folder of the manifest meta data (including manifest_stub.xml)
        Throws:
        OpenCmsMetaXmlParseException - if the XmlHelper can not be initialized or the manifest stub file or any meta file can not be read or parsed
        OpenCmsMetaXmlFileWriteException - if the resulting manifest file can not be written

      • generateManifest

        public void generateManifest(java.io.File manifestRoot,
                    java.lang.String realFileRootPath)
                      throws OpenCmsMetaXmlParseException,
                             OpenCmsMetaXmlFileWriteException
        Generates the manifest.xml for OpenCms modules from meta files (manifest_stub.xml and separate meta files for all files and folders in the VFS).
        Parameters:
        manifestRoot - file representing the root folder of the manifest meta data (including manifest_stub.xml)
        realFileRootPath - root path under which the real files (not the meta files) are stored. Used to get the modification date, may be null (if so the meta file's modification date is used)
        Throws:
        OpenCmsMetaXmlParseException - if the XmlHelper can not be initialized or the manifest stub file or any meta file can not be read or parsed
        OpenCmsMetaXmlFileWriteException - if the resulting manifest file can not be written

      • getMetaInfoPath

        public static java.lang.String getMetaInfoPath(java.lang.String manifestRoot,
                               java.lang.String vfsPath,
                               boolean isFolder)
        Gets the path to the meta info file for the VFS file or folder at the given VFS path.
        Parameters:
        manifestRoot - root folder of the manifest meta files
        vfsPath - VFS path of the given VFS file or folder
        isFolder - true if the VFS resource is a folder, false otherwise
        Returns:
        "[vfsPath].ocmsfile.xml" for files, "[vfsPath].ocmsfolder.xml" for folders

      • setModuleVersion

        public void setModuleVersion(java.lang.String moduleVersion)
        Allows to set a specific module version that is replacing the module version from the manifest stub.
        Parameters:
        moduleVersion - the String to be used as the module version, if null or empty the version is not changed

      • setReplaceDateVariables

        public void setReplaceDateVariables(boolean replaceDateVariables)
        Sets the flag indicating if date variables (${datelastmodified} and ${datecreated}) should be replaced with generated values.
        Parameters:
        replaceDateVariables - true if date variables should be replaced, false otherwise

      • setReplaceIdVariables

        public void setReplaceIdVariables(boolean replaceIdVariables)
        Sets the flag indicating if UUID variables (${uuidstructure} and ${uuidresource}) should be replaced with generated values.
        Parameters:
        replaceIdVariables - true if UUID variables should be replaced, false otherwise

      • setReplaceMetaVariables

        public void setReplaceMetaVariables(boolean replaceMetaVariables)
        Deprecated. Use setReplaceDateVariables(boolean) and setReplaceIdVariables(boolean) instead, may be removed in future versions.
        Sets the flag indicating if meta variables (${uuidstructure}, ${uuidresource}, ${datelastmodified} and ${datecreated}) should be replaced with generated values.
        Parameters:
        replaceMetaVariables - true if meta variables should be replaced, false otherwise
